Honey and Lemon: Honey has natural antibacterial and soothing properties, while lemon is rich in vitamin C. Mixing the two can help alleviate symptoms of a cold, such as sore throat and cough.
Ginger Tea: Ginger has anti-inflammatory and immune-boosting properties, making it a great remedy for a cold. Boiling ginger in water and adding honey or lemon can create a soothing tea.
Garlic: Garlic is known for its antibacterial and antiviral properties. Consuming garlic in various forms, such as raw or cooked, can help fight off cold-causing viruses.

Rest and Hydration: Getting enough rest and staying hydrated is crucial for recovering from a cold. Drinking plenty of water, herbal teas, or warm broth can help alleviate symptoms and promote healing.

Probiotics: Probiotics can help boost the immune system and prevent the spread of cold-causing viruses. Consuming foods or supplements that contain probiotics, such as yogurt or kefir, can help support overall health and wellness.
